UniprotID	P00738
Accession	P00738;B0AZL5;P00737;Q0VAC4;Q0VAC5;Q2PP15;Q3B7J0;Q6LBY9;Q9UC67
EntryName	HPT_HUMAN
ProteinName	Haptoglobin (Zonulin) [Cleaved into: Haptoglobin alpha chain; Haptoglobin beta chain]
GeneName	HP
Length	406
Function	As a result of hemolysis, hemoglobin is found to accumulate in the kidney and is secreted in the urine. Haptoglobin captures, and combines with free plasma hemoglobin to allow hepatic recycling of heme iron and to prevent kidney damage. Haptoglobin also acts as an antioxidant, has antibacterial activity, and plays a role in modulating many aspects of the acute phase response. Hemoglobin/haptoglobin complexes are rapidly cleared by the macrophage CD163 scavenger receptor expressed on the surface of liver Kupfer cells through an endocytic lysosomal degradation pathway.
Subcellular Location	Secreted
